alert.note: Alert for Coal (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 4:14AM CDT until June 02 at 4:37PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Atoka and Coal. * WHEN...Until 715 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 414 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Atoka, Coalgate, Stringtown, Lehigh, Tushka, Caney, Lane, Olney, Daisy, Phillips, Atoka Reservoir, Bentley, McGee Creek Lake, Chockie, Boggy Depot Park and Redden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
